A super mom with no arms uses her feet to sew clothing for her children.

I was curious about her so I did some digging and came across an article from July 17th, 1954 in an Australian magazine called Pix. Below is an excerpt:

‚ÄúPHYLLIS LUMLEY moved across the kitchen in her six-roomed house at Battersea, London, picked up her three-week-old baby Mark and sat him on her lap. It is a simple action in the telling, but for Mrs. Lumley it marked a tale of singular triumph over adversity.

For Mrs, Lumley was born without arms and with one withered foot 6in shorter than the other. Since birth she has been accustomed to use her feet as other people use their hands. A woman with a naturally happy disposition, Phyllis Lumley recalls few moments of anxiety or fear until she knew that her first baby was on the way, ‚ÄòStrangely,‚Äô she says, ‚Äòthey were just the usual fears and anxieties that every mother goes through the first time. I never once had a thought that the child might be born like myself‚Äîdeformed.‚Äô 

Frequently in her childhood she had seen expectant mothers start at the sight of her, heard them remark with almost medieval superstition, ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt let that child come near me. My own baby might be born like her!‚Äô 

But when the time came, for her own prenatal visits to the clinic she found that doctors and other mothers of a more enlightened age treated her as though she were perfectly normal. Phyllis admits, ‚ÄòRight after the baby was born, I‚Äôm afraid I did ask whether she was all right. Then they brought her to me and it was the most wonderful moment in my whole life. She was just perfect.‚Äô

Mrs. Lumley has had six other babies since then. Every one of them is physically perfect, too.‚Äù

This is a drawing of Elvis Presley by a 14-year-old Jimi Hendrix after seeing him in concert. 

I did some digging and found out that this Elvis concert took place at Sick‚Äôs Stadium in Seattle, Washington on September 1st, 1957 to a crowd of 16,000 people (90% of whom were teenage girls). Tickets were going for $1.50, $2.50, and $3.50.

Elvis closed out his concert with ‚ÄúHound Dog‚Äù. According to reporter, John Voorhees from the Seattle Post-Intelligencer, the scream from the audience sounded like ‚Äú12,000 girls all having their heads shaved at once.‚Äù Elvis only sang two choruses from his hit song before he vanished from the stage and disappeared into the night.

A year later, 15-year-old Jimi Hendrix would buy an acoustic guitar for $5 and the rest is history. 

Interestingly enough, Hendrix‚Äôs last hometown performance would also be at Sick‚Äôs Stadium 13 years later on July 26, 1970.

Reagan reacting to balloon popping during his speech in then West Berlin, two years before the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1987.

In 1981, Reagan had survived an assassination attempt in Washington D.C. where he was struck by a bullet in his rib and was coughing up blood. At the emergency room, Reagan told his wife, ‚ÄúHoney, I forgot to duck.‚Äù 

Before his operation to remove the bullet, Reagan remarked to doctors and nurses, ‚ÄúI hope you are all Republicans‚Äù to which the lead doctor, a Democrat, replied, ‚ÄúToday, Mr. president, we are all Republicans.‚Äù

The bullet was successfully removed and Reagan survived despite losing over half of his blood volume.

The Shining was perhaps the first horror movie I ever watched and I remember being glued to my television set even though I was terrified out of my mind.

I haven‚Äôt watched the film in over a decade and I can still hear Danny‚Äôs wheels rolling, alternating between the hardwood floor and the carpet, creating this jarring rhythm that continuously builds up as he makes his sharp turns around the long eerie hallways. To this day, I still get uneasy with long hallways because of that scene.

Everyone remembers Jack Nicholson‚Äôs over the top performance, but for me Duvall had the more complex role of showcasing a meek wife that slowly begins to stand up for herself, while trying to keep it together in a horrible relationship. Despite all the verbal and psychological abuse she endured at the hands of Kubrick, Duvall churned out an amazing performance.

This is what she had to say about working with Kubrick: 

‚ÄúFor me it was just tumultuous. I had to cry and hyperventilate and carry a little boy and run for most of the time we shot and that was about a year, a
little over a year. The stress of the role was so great from May until October, I was really in and out of ill health. You always dislike whatever the cause is of pain so I resented Stanley at times because he pushed me and it hurt. Why do you want to do this to me. How can you do this to me‚Ä¶‚Äù

RIP Shelley Duvall

Blue Babe is a 50,000 year old mummified steppe bison that was discovered by gold miners in 1979, north of Fairbanks, Alaska.

Claw and tooth marks on the rear of the bison indicate that it was killed by a North American lion, an extinct Ice Age cat that was 25% larger than the modern lion. The lion managed to open the bison carcass and eat most of its muscle located in the ribs and upper limbs area. However, the bison carcass froze quickly, making it difficult for scavengers to fully consume.

In 1984, a group of paleontologists decided to cook and eat part of the neck muscle of the bison carcass. Professor emeritus of zoology at the University of Alaska, R Dale Guthrie, wrote about the event:

‚ÄúTo climax and celebrate [taxidermist] Eirik Granqvist‚Äôs work with Blue Babe, we had a bison stew dinner for him and for Bjorn Kurten ‚Ä¶ A small part of the mummy‚Äôs neck was diced and simmered in a pot of stock and vegetables. We had Blue Babe for dinner. The meat was well aged but still a little tough, and it gave the stew a strong Pleistocene aroma, but nobody there would have dared miss it.

The meat in its abdomen had spoiled before the bison was completely frozen. But in the neck area small pieces of meat were found attached to the skull. The lions had left so little there that it had frozen through while the meat was still fresh. When it thawed it gave off an unmistakable beef aroma, not unpleasantly mixed with a faint smell of the earth in which it was found, with a touch of mushroom. About a dozen of us gathered .... on April 6, 1984, to partake of Bison priscus stew. The taste was delicious, and none of us suffered any ill effects from the meal.‚Äù

Source: ‚ÄúFood History Almanac: Over 1,300 Years of World Culinary History, Culture, and Social Influence‚Äù by Janet Clarkson

The Six Grandfathers before it was carved up to create Mount Rushmore.
‚Å£
In the Treaty of 1868, the U.S. government promised the Lakota Sioux tribe all of South Dakota, west of the Missouri River. This included the Black Hills, which are considered sacred lands. ‚Å£
‚Å£
However, once gold was discovered in the area in the 1870s, white settlers began to migrate into the area. The U.S. government then broke the treaty and reclaimed the Black Hills. In 1890, tensions reached a boiling point between the white miners and the Lakota Sioux people, which led to the Wounded Knee Massacre, ‚Äúwhere hundreds of unarmed Sioux women, children, and men were shot and killed by U.S. troops‚Äù.‚Å£
‚Å£
According to the National Park Service (nps.gov), the four U.S. presidents (George Washington, Thomas Jefferson,¬†Theodore Roosevelt, and¬†Abraham Lincoln) that make up Mount Rushmore ‚Äútell the story of the birth, growth, development and preservation of this country. From the history of the first inhabitants to the diversity of America today, Mount Rushmore brings visitors face to face with the rich heritage we all share.‚Äù‚Å£
‚Å£
The idea for Mount Rushmore was concocted in the 1920s by a local historian and a sculptor to drive tourism into the area. ‚Å£
‚Å£

The toilet snorkel was patented in 1982.

The invention allowed a trapped individual in a burning high-rise to use the snorkel to breathe until rescue.

Below is more info from the patent application:

‚ÄúThe recent rash of fires in high-rise hotels has resulted in the death of numerous people due to toxic smoke inhalation. Although the various fire departments involved expedited recovery efforts to save such people from impending death, the various toxic gases intermixed with the smoke, resulting from the burning of plastic furniture materials and the like, proved lethal within a very short time period. It has thus proven critical to provide the entrapped hotel guest with a source of fresh air or oxygen until the guest is rescued. Furthermore, experience has shown that the entrapped guest should remain in his or her hotel room, rather than attempt to proceed to the roof or any other floor of the hotel, to facilitate the rescue operation.

A fireman, in performing firefighting and rescue operations of the above type, normally carries a canister of oxygen with him for breathing purposes. On occasion, the fireman will deplete his supply of oxygen to thus also subject himself to toxic smoke inhalation. Therefore, it would prove desirable to provide not only a hotel guest with a supply of fresh air, when needed, but to also provide such air to a fireman who may encounter the above type of emergency situation.‚Äù

Source: https://patents.google.com/patent/US4320756A/en

9-year-old girl April, carries her family on her back (over 425 lbs) in Muscle Beach, Cal, 1945.

‚ÄúBruce [Lee] had me up to three miles a day, really at a good pace. We‚Äôd run the three miles in twenty-one or twenty-two minutes. Just under eight minutes a mile [Note: when running on his own in 1968, Lee would get his time down to six-and-a-half minutes per mile]. So this morning he said to me ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre going to go five.‚Äô I said, ‚ÄòBruce, I can‚Äôt go five. I‚Äôm a helluva lot older than you are, and I can‚Äôt do five.‚Äô‚Å£
‚Å£
He said, ‚ÄòWhen we get to three, we‚Äôll shift gears and it‚Äôs only two more and you‚Äôll do it.‚Äô I said ‚ÄòOkay, hell, I‚Äôll go for it.‚Äô So we get to three, we go into the fourth mile and I‚Äôm okay for three or four minutes, and then I really begin to give out. I‚Äôm tired, my heart‚Äôs pounding, I can‚Äôt go any more and so I say to him, ‚ÄòBruce, if I run any more,‚Äô ‚Äî and we‚Äôre still running ‚Äî ‚Äòif I run any more I‚Äôm liable to have a heart attack and die.‚Äô He said, ‚ÄòThen die.‚Äô‚Å£
‚Å£
It made me so mad that I went the full five miles. Afterward I went to the shower and then I wanted to talk to him about it. I said, you know, ‚ÄòWhy did you say that?‚Äô He said, ‚ÄòBecause you might as well be dead. Seriously, if you always put limits on what you can do, physical or anything else, it‚Äôll spread over into the rest of your life. It‚Äôll spread into your work, into your morality, into your entire being. There are no limits. There are plateaus, but you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.‚Äô‚Äù‚Å£
‚Å£
- John Little,¬†‚ÄúThe Art of Expressing the Human Body‚Äù (1998)

The Huichol are Indigenous people that originated from the deep mountains of Central Mexico some 15,000 years ago. Today, they live in the Sierra Madre Occidental mountains and work as subsistence farmers, growing maize, beans, squash, and cucumbers.

According to their ancient traditions, both men and women experience the pain of childbirth together. The father would position himself on the rafters with rope tied around his scrotum, which would be pulled by the mother during delivery.

Today, we know very little of the medical knowledge and birth customs of the Indigenous people of the Americas because much of their hand-painted manuscripts were destroyed by Spanish conquistadors and missionaries who viewed them as ‚Äúpagan‚Äù practices.

‚ÄúDroodles‚Äù are a form of cartoon or drawing that consist of a combination of doodle and riddle.

Created by American humorist Roger Price in the 1950s, Droodles are simple, abstract, or seemingly nonsensical sketches with witty, humorous titles that explain or interpret the drawing in a surprising way.

Droodles became quite popular as a cultural phenomenon, featured in books, used as party games, and even incorporated into television shows and advertisements. The charm of Droodles lies in their simplicity and the delightful twist provided by the unexpected titles that accompany them, inviting the viewer to think creatively and find amusement in ordinary or ambiguous shapes.

Portrait of a Filipina/Chinese woman from the Philippines, 1875 üì∏: Francisco Van Camp

I‚Äôve always wondered why Filipino is not spelled Philipino, since the country is spelled the Philippines.

So I did some digging and discovered that the ‚Äúph‚Äù sound doesn‚Äôt really exist in Tagalog (the national language of the Philippines). Most native Filipinos will pronounce it as ‚Äúpilipino‚Äù instead, which is typically shortened to ‚Äúpinoy.‚Äù The reason the country is called the Philippines is because the country was named after King Philip the II (1527-1598) of Spain.

Before the first European explorers arrived in the Philippines, there was no national identity, only clans and tribes spread out across the archipelago. This made it very easy for the Europeans to conquer the region since the division already existed amongst the people.

The Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan was the first European to come in contact with the Philippines in March 1521. Magellan was driven by fervent religious zeal to convert the local tribes to Christianity and as a result, got embroiled in a local political dispute and was killed during battle. Although he is often credited as the first person to circumnavigate the world, Magellan himself never completed the journey.

After his death, his crew was captained by Juan Sebastian Elcano who continued the journey. They arrived in Spain in September of 1522, which was nearly a year and a half after Magellan‚Äôs death. Approximately 80% of the original crew members died during the voyage around the world.

Some historians believe that the first person to complete the trip around the world was a man by the name of Enrique of Malacca. At only 14-years-old, Enrique was enslaved by Magellan during the capture of Malacca by the Portuguese in 1511. He would go on to accompany Magellan back to Portugal, then to Spain, and then finally embark on the expedition to circumnavigate the world.

After Magellan‚Äôs death, Enrique bailed on the expedition when he was able to recognize the language that the local inhabitants were speaking, most likely because he had originally been born and raised in the Philippines before being brought to Malacca.

#aapi

One of the oldest cat videos (1899) by Louis Lumi√®re. 

I got a lot of messages asking me if I had any background information about the girl in the video and all I could find was that her name was Madeleine Koehler who may have been a relative or daughter of a family friend to Lumi√®re. She was born on June 1, 1895 in Lyon, France, which puts her around 4 or 5 years of age when this footage was taken. Not much else is known about her except the fact that she died in 1970 at age 75. 

For some perspective into her life, Koehler would have been 8 years old when Wilbur and Orville Wright flew the first powered aircraft at Kitty Hawk. In 1912, Koehler was 16 years old when the Titanic sank off the coast of Newfoundland in 1912. Two years later, she would witness the beginning of World War 1. The bulk of the fighting would occur in her home country along the Western Front, a 400 mile stretch of land that weaved thought Belgium, Luxembourg, Alsace-Lorraine, and France. Machine guns, poison gas, tanks, and airplanes would be used for the first time in warfare.

By the time the war came to an end, more than 20 million people had died and Koehler would have just turned 23. In the fall of that same year, as soldiers began to return back home, a deadly pandemic would spread across the globe, infecting approximately 500 million people, a third of the world‚Äôs population at the time. It would last two years, killing an estimated 50 million people.

Just as life seemed to get good during the Roaring Twenties, the Great Depression hits the U.S. in 1929 when Koehler was 34 years old. And like the pandemic of 1918, it too began to spread, plunging the world‚Äôs GDP by 26.7%.¬† 

As economies around the world started to deteriorate during the 1930s, Nazi power began to rise. In 1939, a 44 year old Koehler watched as her country declared war on Germany for invading Poland. Over the next six years, 75 million people would die.

Wars continued throughout Koehler‚Äôs 50s and 60s. However, on July 20, 1969, a 74 year old Koehler would have witnessed something remarkable. Humans who were capable of such death and destruction, achieving what was thought to be impossible‚Äîlanding on the moon.

These are called Witches‚Äô Stairs.

It is believed that the design was thought to confuse or trap witches, preventing them from easily climbing the stairs due to the staggered pattern.

Unlike traditional stairs with a regular series of steps, witches‚Äô stairs alternate, with each step offset to either the left or right. This design creates a zig-zag pattern, allowing for a steep incline without requiring a large horizontal space.

You will occasionally find them in very old New England homes.

Lady Dai, also known as Xin Zhui, is one of the most famous mummies in the world, discovered in 1971 at the Mawangdui archaeological site in Changsha, China. She was the wife of Li Cang, the Marquis of Dai, during the Han Dynasty, and she died around 163 BCE. Her extraordinarily well-preserved mummy provides an invaluable glimpse into the health, lifestyle, and mortuary practices of the Han Dynasty.

What makes Lady Dai‚Äôs mummy so remarkable is the condition in which it was found. Despite being over 2,000 years old, her body was remarkably preserved: her skin was soft and moist, her limbs could be flexed, her hair was intact, and her internal organs were still in place. This exceptional preservation is attributed to the elaborate burial methods used, which included sealing her coffin in airtight layers of charcoal and clay, effectively preventing decay.

The tomb of Lady Dai also contained more than 1,000 artifacts and documents, offering insights into the culture and daily life of the time. These included exquisite silk garments, lacquerware, musical instruments, and foods that were buried with her, presumably to provide comfort in the afterlife.

Additionally, the texts found alongside her body, including some of the earliest versions of Daoist texts and medical manuscripts, have provided scholars with significant information on ancient Chinese philosophy, science, and medicine. The autopsy of her body revealed details about her health, showing that she suffered from various ailments such as heart disease, high blood pressure, and diabetes‚Äîconditions not uncommon today but only understood through the lens of modern science. 

Lady Dai‚Äôs tomb and mummy continue to be a crucial source for understanding ancient Chinese history and the advancements in burial practices that were aimed at preserving the dead with such incredible fidelity.

#ancientchina
#mummy

After years of requests, I finally put my big girl pants on and created a Full Body Drawing Guide for kids! 

One of my favorite things to teach is figuring drawing but the concept of gesture drawing, proportions, light, loose lines, etc can be difficult for children under 10 to fully grasp. I remember being a kids and looking at drawing books that would have 10+ steps where the lines were intended to built upon and then erased at the end but i started the drawing in marker and couldn‚Äôt go backwards ü´† So I started just skipping to the last step of these guided drawings and just teaching myself to following the contour line. 

It‚Äôs these vivid memories I have as a kid that shaped this entire guide (well and frankly all my drawing guides) because as an elementary art teacher of 15 years I saw so much of my own memories in my own students. 

This guide is now available on my website / TpT! Just comment the word ‚Äúlink‚Äù and I‚Äôll send you a dm with the link to the guide! Those of you who have my Guided Drawing Growing Bundle on TpT, just redownload the resource and you‚Äôll find it‚Äôs been added! Happy drawing!!

What an incredible afternoon celebrating the unveiling of the new Charles ‚ÄúTeenie‚Äù Harris Archive Gallery at @carnegiemuseumofart!! Experiencing Harris‚Äô iconic photographs alongside a jazz performance by the amazing RH Factor was such a treat. To be able to look around the concert hall and see such pure joy being brought to so many people through art and music coming together was an experience I won‚Äôt soon forget. My cheeks literally hurt from smiling the entire time ‚ù§Ô∏è

For those who may not know, Charles ‚ÄúTeenie‚Äù Harris, often called ‚ÄúOne Shot‚Äù Harris, was a master of documenting the vibrancy of everyday life in Pittsburgh‚Äôs Hill District and beyond from the 1930s to the 1970s. His collection, which includes over 70,000 images, depicting everything from civil rights marches to jazz performances, community celebrations, and intimate family moments.

If you‚Äôre a local, or in Pittsburgh for a visit, highly recommend checking out the new Charles ‚ÄúTeenie‚Äù Harris Archive Exhibit now open at @carnegiemuseumofart üôåüèº ‚ù§Ô∏è

I often get DMs from parents saying things like, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not very creative myself, but I want to encourage my child to make more art‚Ä¶ Do you have any tips?‚Äô My advice? 

Ask Them Questions! üôåüèº

 All you have to do is start by asking questions about the work they‚Äôre already drawing! This is a free way to make a big impact in encouraging your kiddos. 

So here are some questions you can ask your kiddo to help you connect and support their creativity (Save this post if you need to!) 

1. Can you tell me about what‚Äôs happening in your picture?
2. What made you choose those colors?
3. How did you decide to start your drawing this way?
4. What‚Äôs your favorite part of this drawing?
5. Were you thinking about anything special while you drew this?
6. What was the hardest part to draw, and how did you figure it out?
7. Is there a story behind this picture?
8. How does this drawing make you feel?
9. What would you add or change if you kept working on it?
10. What part of your picture are you most PROUD of and why? 

These simple yet important questions show your child that you value their work & creativity. It encourages their self-expression, and helps them to feel proud of their work‚Äî and will help you to see the world through your child‚Äôs lens. 

Their artwork is a glimpse into how your child sees the world, how they share their heart, tell a story, and express feelings. Their art is a powerful way of communication that we shouldn‚Äôt just glaze over but instead engage, and ask our child to tell us more. 

So take a moment to ask questions about their work, because chances are there is so much more in each line than what meets the eye ü©∑

Happy National Black Dog Day! ‚ù§Ô∏èüêï‚Äçü¶∫ 

Did you know that black dogs and dogs of darker shades are less likely to be adopted than others?  The loyalty and love of a black dog is no different and yet black dogs are often overlooked. 

12 years ago I made the best decision of my life by adopting my sweet Maddie from @pethelperssc . I was in a rough spot at the time and I decided to spontaneously visit our local animal shelter and that‚Äôs when I spotted a small black pup with the most gentle eyes behind the bars. There was my girl. As soon as we met we knew we needed each other. I know it‚Äôs cliche by the phase ‚Äúwho rescued who?‚Äù Couldn‚Äôt have been more spot on for us. That evening when I practically came skipping out of the animal shelter, I met my husband because I was oozing happiness. And the rest was history ‚ù§Ô∏è 

It‚Äôs been a full week now since we lost our sweet Maddie, and though I miss her terribly, I am so grateful for every moment I had with her and the beautiful life she gave me. She will be in my heart forever. 

If you‚Äôre thinking about getting a dog for your family, please please consider adopting‚Ä¶ especially a black dog. You never know how they might completely change your life ‚ù§Ô∏èüêæ

I will love you and miss you forever my Maddie girl. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Oh hi!! You‚Äôre here! Hooray!! 

I‚Äôm Kaitlyn, a certified art educator, artist and sketchbook enthusiast who loves nothing more than drawing or painting outside on a lovely day ‚òÄÔ∏è

If you are looking for ‚Äúmore time‚Äù to make art, I have some bad news, you aren‚Äôt going to magically find it. But the GOOD NEWS is that I‚Äôm here to help you break the idea that you have to have the perfect working conditions/ studio/ infinite amount of uninterrupted time to make art. Because you don‚Äôt. Life is busy, and unfortunately things like painting for fun get pushed to the bottom of our priorities when push comes to shove. That‚Äôs why my husband and I created the @shop.quell  Carrier Case. To help you ditch the excuses and instead literally grab the solution to making more art! When you decide to swap out doom scrolling for drawing or painting in your sketchbook, something *magic* happens. You spend the same amount of time actually benefiting your mental health, calming your nervous system, gaining mental clarity & focus, and not to mention create something that has never existed in the world before! I mean cmon! How amazing is that?!? 

8 years ago I started my sketchbook practice and decided that if I wanted to make art everyday, things had to be portable so I could make art anytime I experienced wait time. Waiting at the doctors office? Sketchbook. Waiting in the car line to pick up my kid? Grab my sketchbook. This umbilical cord has a facial expression, and he‚Äôs shocked! üò±
Just realized it‚Äôs been in the dark for nine months!

The image shows a cross-section of an umbilical cord, where two arteries and one vein are visible. The structure appears almost face-like, with the arteries resembling eyes and the vein looking like a mouth.

The umbilical cord serves as a critical connection between a developing fetus and the placenta, delivering oxygen, nutrients, and essential waste removal.

The two smaller circles (arteries) carry deoxygenated blood from the fetus to the placenta, while the larger circle (vein) brings oxygenated blood and nutrients back to the fetus. These vessels are surrounded by Wharton‚Äôs jelly, a protective, gelatinous tissue that cushions the vessels from compression. This arrangement, often resembling a ‚Äúface,‚Äù is a normal anatomical feature of the umbilical cord.

Clean cut removal of a GIANT gouty tophus!
This is the pre- and post-operative resection of gout tophus out of an elbow!!
Tophi are crystalline deposits made out of ureates or ureic acid in patients suffering from gout.
Gout is a form of inflammatory arthritis characterized by recurrent attacks of a red, tender, hot, and swollen joint, where crystals in the form of monosodium urate form inside and around joints (called tophi).
The most known hallmark of the disease is hyperuricemia, but by itself it does not indicate gout. 
Hyperuricemia means an increased production of uric acid due either a defect or hyperactivity in different enzymes and increased cell turnover (or cell breakdown) in patients that use chemotherapy for cancer, have chronic hemolysis, or have hematologic malignancies. 
Another, even more common reason for gout is decreased excretion of uric acid by the kidneys due to renal disease or NSAID or diuretics usage. 
Inflammation typically develops when uric acid collect in the synovial fluid as the extracellular fluid becomes saturated with the acid which is then phagocytized by polymorphonuclear cells. This process develops inflammation. 
Pain typically comes on rapidly in less than 12 hours. The joint at the base of the big toe is affected in about half of cases. It may also result in tophi, kidney stones, or urate nephropathy.
Severe gout is characterised by frequent polyarticular flares, numerous tophi, joint damage, and musculoskeletal disability. This is a preventable condition and in many cases, represents a disease that has been insufficiently managed for years. Standard management recommendations may be insufficient for patients with severe gout; these patients frequently require intensive individualised pharmacological management with combinations of urate-lowering therapy and anti-inflammatory agents.

Reaching for life! 
This image depicts a deeply moving moment of a preterm baby, born at just 24 weeks gestation and weighing 570 grams.
Babies born this early are considered micro-preemies, facing extraordinary challenges, as they are highly vulnerable to numerous complications due to underdeveloped organs and systems. The image, showing a tiny hand reaching out, reflects the fragility and resilience of life in its earliest and most vulnerable state.

At 24 weeks, the lungs, brain, and digestive system are not fully developed, requiring intense medical intervention in a neonatal intensive care unit (NICU). This baby is likely receiving life-sustaining support, including mechanical ventilation or continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) for immature lungs, intravenous nutrition, and possibly phototherapy for jaundice. Every day is critical for a micro-preemie like this, with survival dependent on advanced neonatal care and the gradual maturation of vital organs.

Despite the overwhelming challenges, the hand reaching out is a symbol of hope‚Äîa testament to the potential for survival and the tireless efforts of healthcare professionals in the NICU to provide this baby the best chance at life.

Table saw vs hand!
This patient accidentally got too close to a table saw, resulting in a deep laceration through the pinky and thumb.
The injury extends through the tendons and veins, with the flexor digitorum superficialis tendon clearly severed. Notice the tendon bulging out of the wound, indicating a complete tear of the tendon.

The flexor digitorum superficialis tendon (FDS) is one of the key tendons responsible for flexion in the fingers. Each finger, except the thumb, has an FDS tendon that allows flexion at the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint, which is crucial for gripping and fine motor tasks. Without proper function of this tendon, the patient would have difficulty with any activity requiring finger flexion, such as grasping objects or making a fist.

In this case the pinky (5th digit) was severed from the table saw. The FDS tendon to the pinky is responsible for flexing the PIP joint. After the tendon is torn, the patient basically loses the ability to bend this joint, leading to reduced or incomplete flexion of the pinky.

In the case of the thumb, while the FDS tendon doesn‚Äôt exist in the thumb, the flexor pollicis longus tendon performs a similar function for thumb flexion. If the thumb‚Äôs tendons are severed, there would be difficulty flexing the thumb.

This patient went through tendon and vascular repair surgeries and the last photo shows the follow-up after one year of rehabilitation. He re-gained tendon integrity and most of its function back! ‚úãüèº

Patient lives on an artificial heart also known as ‚Äúventricular assist device‚Äù (VAD) ‚Äî a mechanical device that is implanted into the body to replace the function of a failing natural heart!!

Ever wondered someone dying from heart problem and all at sudden doctors hit up with a strange experimental idea and replace the heart with a pump to save that person. This is where the left ventricular assist device, aka the pump, comes handy! 
Cardiac transplantation is an option for patients with severe heart failure, and a left ventricular assist device, or LVAD, may help to bridge a patient while awaiting transplantation.
The LVAD is a battery-operated, mechanical pump, which helps the left ventricle pump blood to the rest of the body in patients who have reached end-stage heart failure. 
In other words, it‚Äôs a mechanical circulatory support that is used to salvage the cardiogenic shock patient and as a bridge to transplant therapy, but can also be permanent or be used for destination therapy.
By restoring the failing heart, it temporarily eliminates the need for a transplant.
Over the past several years, there has been a dramatic shift from the use of large pulsatile left ventricular assist devices (LVADs) to the use of smaller continuous-flow devices for the provision of mechanical circulatory support in patients with heart failure.

How did this cute little fetus cause someone to die? 
It‚Äôs got tiny little hands.
This was a tubal or ectopic pregnancy that resulted in a ruptured fallopian tube and severe bleeding.

Ectopic (‚Äòmisplaced‚Äô) pregnancy occurs when a fertilized egg implants outside the uterine cavity, most commonly in the fallopian tube (tubal pregnancy). Less commonly, in locations such as the ovary, cervix, or abdominal cavity. The implantation of the pregnancy in a non-uterine location means that it cannot progress to term, and it poses a significant risk to the patient‚Äôs health.

As it grows, it can cause tubal distension, eventually leading the tubal bursts/rupture, which results in severe intra-abdominal bleeding and can cause life-threatening hemorrhagic shock.

Clinically, ruptured ectopic pregnancy presents with acute lower abdominal pain, signs of peritoneal irritation, hemodynamic instability (hypotension, tachycardia), vaginal bleeding and possibly referred shoulder pain from diaphragmatic irritation. Diagnosis is confirmed via transvaginal ultrasound (empty uterus, adnexal mass) and elevated Œ≤-hCG levels that do not rise appropriately.

Treatment for rupture is typically emergency surgery (laparoscopy or laparotomy) to control bleeding and remove the ectopic tissue and either a part of the whole fallopian tube along with the pregnancy will be surgically removed.

Finger dislocation sliding into 3rd base playing softball!!
The finger was reduced on the field by his coach and he continued playing.
(The second photo is not the actual patient, but to better visualize the position of the dislocated phalanx).
Finger dislocation is a common injury. It occurs when the bones of the finger are moved (dislocated) from their normal position. Foremost among these injuries is the dorsal dislocation of the proximal interphalangeal  joint caused by a hyperextension injury.
But in simpler words, it can occur in any of the joints of any finger, but it occurs most often in the middle knuckle of the little, ring, middle, or index finger.
 
Treatment includes reduction which is the medical term for repositioning the bone into its proper place.
Patients whose digits have neurovascular compromise, an open joint dislocation, ligamentous or volar plate rupture, joint instability, or an associated fracture should be immediately evaluated by an orthopedic or hand specialist to manage potential subtle ligamentous, cartilaginous, or bony injury.

The mighty power of MRI magnets!!

Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) machines use powerful magnets to generate detailed images of the body‚Äôs internal structures. The strength of the magnet in an MRI machine is measured in teslas (T).
Most clinical MRI machines have magnet strengths of 1.5T or 3T, with 3T being more common in modern facilities due to its higher image resolution and faster scan times.

The magnets in MRI machines are thousands of times stronger than household magnets. A 1.5T MRI magnet is 300,000 times stronger than the Earth‚Äôs magnetic field (~50 ¬µT), while a 3T MRI magnet is double that strength. These magnets are powerful enough to realign hydrogen atoms in the body, enabling the MRI to generate detailed internal images.

There are also ultra-high-field MRI machines that operate at 7T or even higher, primarily used in research settings for their superior imaging capabilities and ability to provide more detailed information about soft tissues, brain structures, and other areas of the body.

Better start checking these eyebrow bumps üò•
This is a case of a 79 year old man who presented to the hospital with a large fungating right facial mass. He reports first noticing a small growth at the right eyebrow over a year ago. Over time, he had become increasingly self conscious of the mass and was isolating himself at home, refusing to go out or seek medical attention. On MRI, the mass extended deep into the right orbit with marked destruction of the right globe, the medial orbital wall, ethmoid, frontal and maxillary sinuses. Biopsy demonstrated invasive squamous cell carcinoma. 
‚Å†
The patient underwent extensive surgery including wide resection of right facial squamous cell carcinoma, right partial maxillectomy with orbital exenteration, right partial rhinectomy and modified right neck dissection. He required temporary tracheostomy and gastrostomy tube immediately after surgery. Although very locally invasive, he did not have nodal or distant metastases. For his stage IV T4N0M0 disease, he completed a course of radiation. Although he tolerated multiple surgery and radiation treatments, he continued to have ongoing depression. He lacks social support and continues to have difficulty coping with his chronic illness. .‚Å†
‚Å†
Cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas (SCCs) are common lesions usually cured with local therapy in over 90 percent of cases. Compared to basal cell carcinomas, cutaneous SCCs have a higher potential for local recurrence and regional or distant metastases. In determining how to manage cutaneous SCC, the risk of local regional recurrence and regional or distant metastasis is the most important factor.‚Å†
Credit: Annie K. Hung MD, Hanley Ma MD at: Journal of General Internal Medicine.‚Å†‚Å†

Frostbitten fingers!
On 17th of July 2021 climber Fahad Badar (who later became the 1st Arab man to double summit Everest & Lhotse in one trip) started the fateful summit push on Broadpeak and by summit the next day several accidents happened leaving him hypothermic and his hands severely frostbitten.

Never in a million years did he ever think he would lose his fingers to frostbite, especially doing what love most - climbing mountains.
His life, his body will never be the same again after this life changing surgery.
He was told by surgeons he will never climb again. He challenged them and climbed K2 summit just 10 months after surgery. He says ‚Äúnever say never, everything is possible if you put your mind on it‚Äù.

Frostbite is a type of gangrene caused by freezing of the skin and underlying tissues.
The nature of frostbite has been highly controversial. Until recently, it was believed that it was a direct thermal injury to the tissue. Others believed the indirect injury resulted from changes in the microcirculation. It appears both mechanisms are important. 
Cold can destroy tissue directly by forming intracellular ice crystals or more commonly by interstitial freezing with consequent extraction of water from the cells. But the blood supply to the frozen area also undergoes profound changes. 
Frostbite causes tortuous dilatation of the small vessels, as well as occlusions and intravascular tubular filling defects. Vascular stasis follows, causing ischemia and subsequent tissue necrosis and gangrene ‚Äî death of tissue resulting from gradual loss of blood supply. The tissue slowly dies because it receives little or no oxygen and nutrients from the blood, but it does not become infected (i.e. In cases of wet gangrene).
The first symptoms experienced are numbness and tingling sensation in the affected area. 
The severity of tissue damage depends upon the degree and the duration of cold. Thus, wind, wetness, contact with metal, or anything that speeds heat loss increases the danger to exposed parts of the body.
The frostbitten limb undergoes acute changes within hours and in situations like this, amputation is done to prevent progression.
Credit to @fahad917

Talk about Father‚Äôs Day most inspiring and encouraging story.
A man who suffered devastating 3rd- and 4th-degree burns to over 40% of his body after surviving the deadly Station nightclub fire has shared his joy at the birth of his baby daughter!!

This is Joe. On February 20th, 2003 while enjoying a rock concert with a girlfriend, a special effects malfunction caused a fire to break out after using pyrotechnics in their set.
A hundred people died and more than 200 were injured as concert-goers desperately tried to escape. Some, like Joe and his former girlfriend, suffocated among the crowd.

The nightclub was way over capacity. Realizing quickly what was going on I made my way from near the front row to the nearest exit. In an effort to protect Karla, I placed my leather vest over her.
As we made it towards the exit people fell in front of me and then on top of me. Karla suffocated and did not survive, but she was not burned.
I was trapped and conscious throughout the entire ordeal. I could hear everything going on around me. The sounds of yelling were quite loud. Then it grew quieter and quieter. Then it was just me.
Next, I heard the voice of a firefighter, ‚Äúwe‚Äôve got one over here.‚Äù

After suffering burns to 40 per cent of his body and nearly losing his scalp, he spent a year in hospital undergoing skin grafts. He lost his fingers, toes and his left eye. 
To date I have had 128 tune-ups (surgeries) and counting. I will continue to have surgeries for the rest of my life.

But in 2007 he met Carrie, who herself had been burned as a child, at a burn victims conference. They are got engaged after 2 years and welcomed their first child Hadley shortly after.
‚ÄúHadley‚Äôs so cute. I feel happy, nervous, fulfilled. Nobody knows what‚Äôs coming in an hour or two or five. I‚Äôm just determined to be the best dad I can be.
I went into surgery to receive a hand transplant ‚Äì so now I can feel my baby daughter‚Äôs soft hair.‚Äù

Severe case of psoriasis after the patches have been scraped off!
Psoriasis is a complex immune-mediated disorder that presents as inflammatory plaques in the skin.
This multifactorial, inflammatory disease that involves hyperproliferation of the keratinocytes in the epidermis, with an increase in the epidermal cell turnover rate.
These skin patches are typically red, dry, itchy, and scaly. On people with darker skin the patches may be purple in color.
Psoriasis varies in severity from small, localized patches to complete body coverage.
The disease most commonly manifests on the skin of the elbows, knees, scalp, lumbosacral areas, intergluteal clefts, and glans penis.
The most common skin manifestations are scaling, salmon-colored/erythematous macules, papules, and plaques. Typically, the macules are seen first, and these progress to maculopapules and ultimately well-demarcated, noncoherent, silvery plaques overlying a glossy homogeneous erythema. The area of skin involvement varies with the form of psoriasis.
Chronic stationary psoriasis (psoriasis vulgaris) is the most common type of psoriasis. This involves the scalp, extensor surfaces, genitals, umbilicus, and lumbosacral and retroauricular regions.
Plaque psoriasis is characterized by raised, inflamed lesions covered with a silvery white scale. The scale may be scraped away to reveal inflamed skin beneath. This is most common on the extensor surfaces of the knees, elbows, scalp, and trunk.
Guttate psoriasis presents as small salmon-pink papules, 1-10 mm in diameter, predominately on the trunk; the lesions may be scaly. It frequently appears suddenly, 2-3 weeks after an upper respiratory infection with group A beta-hemolytic streptococci.
Pustular psoriasis presents as sterile pustules appearing on the palms and soles or diffusely over the body. It may cycle through erythema, pustules, then scaling.
Erythrodermic psoriasis presents as generalized erythema, pain, itching, and fine scaling; various pustular forms also exist. It typically encompasses nearly the entire body surface area. It may be accompanied by fever, chills, hypothermia, and dehydration secondary to the large body surface area involvement.

Oops! When your pedicle screw goes the extra mile and decides to tour your aorta! üößüõ†Ô∏è

What you see is a pedicle screw projecting into the lumen of the aorta!!
This patient had a spinal surgery, involving instrumentation with pedicle screws.
This patient had a history of multiple spinal posterior fusions with instrumentations. 
He presented with back pain and fever.
CT angiogram showed screw perforation on the aorta at T6.
The patient underwent urgent surgical exploration. Intraoperative findings confirmed aortic perforation by the screw, necessitating emergent endovascular repair.

Although treatment approach has evolved with the advancement of endovascular technology, open surgery remains an option when anatomy or infection is prohibitive.
Major vascular injury during pedicle screw instrumentation of thoracolumbar spine is a rare but significant complication. Presentation can vary from immediate hemorrhage to pseudoaneurysm formation.
Repair with an aortic stent-graft cuff may minimize unnecessary coverage of the descending thoracic aorta and intercostal arteries.

Amazing Anatomy!!
The human body is truly amazing.
This photo shows you a rare glimpse at something that‚Äôs called fascia, it‚Äôs the white covering that is on top of muscle and under the skin!

Fascia is a layer of connective tissue below the skin.‚Äå It surrounds and holds every organ, blood vessel, bone, nerve fiber and muscle in place. The tissue does more than provide internal structure; fascia has nerves that make it almost as sensitive as skin.

Fascia can be broken down into four main layers: superficial, deep, visceral, and parietal.

Superficial fascia is right under the skin. It‚Äôs thicker in the main part of the body (stomach, chest, etc.), and it gets thinner in places further away, like in the hands and feet.
Deep fascia covers bones, muscles, nerves, and blood vessels.
The visceral fascia layer goes around certain organs that settle into the body‚Äôs open spaces, including the lungs, heart, and stomach.

A baby being born in the waters!!
An ‚Äòen caul‚Äô birth is when the baby comes out still inside an intact amniotic sac (caul). This rare thing of beauty happens in less than 1 in 80,000 births.
Those that are born inside their amniotic sac are said to be lucky, special or protected.

We‚Äôve previously featured babies being born within their amniotic sac, or en caul, and these rare births never cease to amaze us. 
The amniotic sac, or bag of water, or membranes, is a balloon-like membrane filled with amniotic fluid that a fetus grows in during pregnancy.
In most cases, rupture of the amniotic sac occurs spontaneously at full term either during or at the beginning of labor. 
If that event doesn‚Äôt take place, amniotomy (an artificial rupture of membranes) is the procedure done by which the amniotic sac is deliberately ruptured so as to cause the release of amniotic fluid. Amniotomy is usually performed for the purpose of inducing or expediting labor. 
An en-caul birth, when a baby emerges still encased in the amniotic sac at birth, is extremely rare but it does not pose a specific risk on the baby nor the mother.
It is a beautiful sight.

Doctors successfully 3D printed this cancer patient a new nose, planted it on his forearm to then re-implant it where it belongs! 
Medical advances are just mind-blowing. 

You often hear that they‚Äôre doing wonderful things with science these days, and when you hear that someone who lost their nose to cancer had one printed and re-grown for them, you have to admit that it‚Äôs true.

The new nose was grown by creating a 3D-printed mold that was then transferred under the skin of her forearm.
There, it grew blood vessels and was eventually able to be transplanted onto her face where it belongs.
The patient had been receiving cancer treatment for squamous cell carcinoma present in her nasal cavity.
The patient, undergoing radiation and chemotherapy in 2013 for nasal cancer, lost a large portion of her nose. After several failed nasal reconstructions, the use of bespoke biomaterials was proposed. 
They recreated her actual nose by 3D printing one made from biomaterial, in collaboration with a manufacturer of bone device.
They overcame the lack of blood vessels by attaching it to her arm first, then once they were established and properly revascularized via the arm‚Äôs skin vessels after approximately 2 months, it was ready to be transplanted to the nasal region by micro-surgery.

Team effort of Claudius Regaud Institute and CHU university hospital of Toulouse, France.

Game, Set, Match ‚Äì and a Patellar Fracture! üéæ When a powerful serve met an unexpected twist, the outcome wasn't just points on the scoreboard but a trip to the ER.
Tennis serves up more than just excitement! üòÖ

A patellar fracture refers to a break in the kneecap (patella), which is a small, triangular bone located at the front of the knee joint, providing it strength of extension. This type of fracture can range from a hairline crack to a complete break, and it often results from a direct blow or trauma to the knee. Clinical presentation typically includes localized pain, swelling, tenderness, and limited mobility of the affected knee joint.

X-rays will determine the¬†type of fracture¬†and the amount of displacement (separation) of the fracture. 
Treatment options depend on factors such as the severity and displacement of the fracture, and may include conservative management with immobilization using braces or casts, or surgical intervention involving open reduction and internal fixation to realign and stabilize the fractured fragments (fractured ends of bone are realigned and held in place with some combination of pins, screws and wires.
Rehabilitation protocols, including physical therapy, are essential components of the management plan to facilitate recovery and restore optimal function of the knee joint.

üü°INSEGNARE AL GRASSO A ‚ÄúBRUCIARE‚Äù IL GRASSO

üî∏I ricercatori dell‚ÄôUniversit√† di Padova e dell‚ÄôIstituto Veneto di Medicina Molecolare hanno scoperto un meccanismo potenzialmente utile a combattere l‚Äôobesit√†.

üî∏Questo meccanismo coinvolge il grasso bruno, un particolare tipo di grasso deputato alla dissoluzione del grasso per generare calore, quindi adatto a ‚Äúbruciare grasso‚Äù. Purtroppo, la sua quantit√† diminuisce con l‚Äôet√†. Per tale motivo, i ricercatori tentano di ‚Äúistruire‚Äù il grasso bianco a fare la medesima cosa (diventando cosi grasso ‚Äúbeige‚Äù).

I ricercatori hanno scoperto che nel grasso di individui normopeso si registrano alti livelli di una proteina chiamata Opa1. Essa √® una proteina mitocondriale che risulta essenziale per controllare il metabolismo e per regolare l‚Äôapoptosi. Non solo, ma in modelli sperimentali si √® visto che Opa1 riesce a convertire il grasso bianco in grasso ‚Äúbeige‚Äù, anche se il meccanismo non √® noto. Tuttavia, altri studi hanno scoperto che sono coinvolti anche ciclo dell‚Äôurea e fumarato, quest‚Äôultimo √® il responsabile della conversione in tessuto ‚Äúbeige‚Äù. Pertanto, la somministrazione di fumarato ha convertito il grasso ‚Äúmagazzino di grassi‚Äù a grasso ‚Äúbrucia grassi‚Äù.

üî∏Questo studio apre, quindi, una via per una terapia efficace contro la ‚Äúadiposopatia‚Äù

üî∏Fonte: The mitochondrial protein Opa1 promoters adipocyte browing that is dependent on urea cycle metabolites ‚Äì Nature Metabolism

üî∑NEUROPATIA E CELIACHIA

üîπIn uno studio pubblicato su JAMA Neurology, i ricercatori hanno raccolto i risultati delle biopsie intestinali di pazienti celiaci. Sono stati raccolti i dati di oltre ventottomila pazienti, le cui condizioni neurologiche sono state messe a confronto con quelle di 139mila individui inseriti nel gruppo di controllo. Lo scopo dello studio era quello di esaminare il rischio di sviluppare neuropatia nei pazienti affetti da celiachia diagnosticata mediante biopsia.

üîπRISULTATI
La celiachia era associata a un rischio 2,5 volte maggiore di neuropatia successiva (IC 95%, p<0,001). Non solo, ma gli studiosi hanno riscontrato un aumento del rischio anche di neuropatia demielinizzante infiammatoria cronica (p=0,001), neuropatia autonomica (p=0,009) e mononeurite multipla (p=0,006). Ciononostante, non c‚Äô√® stata nessuna associazione con la polineuropatia demielinizzante infiammatoria acuta.
Si pu√≤ quindi affermare che i pazienti con celiachia presentano un rischio maggiore di sviluppare neuropatia.
Alla base della celiachia e di alcuni disturbi del sistema nervoso potrebbe esserci un‚Äôorigine autoimmune comune.

üîπFONTE
Thawani SP, Brannagan TH, Lebwohl B, Green PHR, Ludvigsson JF.¬†Rischio di neuropatia tra 28 232 pazienti con celiachia verificata da biopsia.¬†JAMA Neurol.¬†2015;72(7):806‚Äì811.¬†doi:10.1001/jamaneurol.2015.0475

üß´LA ‚ÄúDIETA‚Äù DELLE CELLULE STAMINALI
Alcuni ricercatori dell‚ÄôUniversit√† di Padova, in collaborazione con le Universit√† di Torino e la Statale di Milano, hanno scoperto che la differenziazione delle cellule staminali, anche nelle prime fasi della gravidanza, √® fortemente condizionata dalla disponibilit√† dell‚Äôamminoacido glutammina.
Queste cellule staminali, insieme all‚Äôepiblasto nativo, danno origine a tutte le cellule adulte, ma tale caratteristica √® associata all‚Äôipometilazione del genoma. Si √® osservato come la ridotta capacit√† di formare Œ±-chetoglutarato dalla glutammina, porti ad un aumento della metilazione del DNA. 
üß´La glutammina, infatti, pu√≤ essere eliminata dalla ‚Äúdieta‚Äù di queste cellule, oppure esse possono essere rese incapaci di metabolizzarla, con opportuni trattamenti di laboratorio. Il risultato √® l‚Äôincapacit√† delle cellule staminali di differenziarsi correttamente. Ci√≤ ha portato gli autori ad affermare come l‚Äôambiente, in questo caso attraverso la dieta, influenzi fortemente l‚Äôattivit√† del DNA e il metabolismo cellulare: in carenza di nutrienti, l‚Äôorganismo si tutela bloccando il differenziamento cellulare e quindi lo sviluppo di una nuova vita. 
Poich√© i meccanismi molecolare sono gli stessi, tali risultati possono essere d‚Äôaiuto anche nello studio di varie patologie, tra cui il tumore.

üß´Lo studio √® stato pubblicato su ‚ÄúNature Genetics‚Äù.
Fonte: Betto, RM, Diamante, L., Perrera, V. et al. Controllo metabolico della metilazione del DNA in cellule pluripotenti naive. Nat Genet 53 , 215‚Äì229 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-020-00770-2

Heim (in foto), fungo impiegato in pratiche divinatorie da alcune popolazioni indigene del Messico. Si pu√≤ trovare anche in altri generi fungini come Panaeolus, Inocybe e Stropharia. ‚û°Ô∏èPARTE 1

La sindrome dell'ovaio policistico (PCOS) √® una malattia eterogenea caratterizzata da disfunzione cronica dell'ovulazione e iperandrogenismo.¬†√à considerato il disturbo endocrinologico pi√π comune, colpisce fino al 25% delle donne in et√† riproduttiva ed √® associato ad anomalie metaboliche a lungo termine predisponenti al rischio cardiovascolare, come insulino-resistenza (IR), dislipidemia, disfunzione endoteliale e infiammazione sistemica.¬†La PCOS √® inoltre caratterizzata da livelli sierici elevati di ormone luteinizzante (LH), che provocano una condizione di iperandrogenismo e un conseguente alterato rapporto tra LH e l'ormone follicolo stimolante (FSH).

‚û°Ô∏èIntegrazione con molecole naturali come inositolo, resveratrolo, flavonoidi e flavoni, vitamina C, vitamina E e vitamina D,¬†e gli acidi grassi omega-3, possono contribuire al superamento delle caratteristiche patologiche della PCOS, inclusa la presenza di ovociti immaturi, IR, iperandrogenismo, stress ossidativo e infiammazione.

FOTOTERAPIA NELL‚ÄôITTERO NEONATALE

La fototerapia √® una tecnica a scopo curativo che si basa sull‚Äôuso della luce. Trova impiego nel trattamento dei disturbi dermatologici (psoriasi, acne), del sonno (insonnia) e di alcune malattie psichiatriche (disturbo affettivo stagionale). Come dice il nome stesso, viene eseguita esponendo il paziente in prossimit√† di una fonte di luce naturale o artificiale (‚Äúlight box‚Äù).

La fototerapia rappresenta il trattamento principale a cui sottoporre i neonati  con ittero a bilirubina indiretta. L‚Äôeffetto terapeutico √® dovuto all‚Äôazione di fotodegradazione della bilirubina dopo esposizione del neonato alla luce emessa da lampade fluorescenti. Si utilizzano lampade fluorescenti a luce azzurra (con lunghezza d‚Äôonda di 440-470 nm) poste ad una distanza non superiore a 50 cm rispetto al neonato, o lampade a tubi catodici che emettono fluorescenza blu-verde (con lunghezza d‚Äôonda di 430-490 nm) che risultano pi√π efficaci perch√© posizionabili a distanza di 10 cm dal bambino. Durante il procedimento, il neonato √® nudo o indossa solo il pannolino, ma √® importante che i suoi occhi vengano protetti con apposite maschere.

üü†SVELATI NUOVI MECCANISMI DELL‚ÄôINVECCHIAMENTO

üî∏In uno studio pubblicato sulla rivista Nature, alcuni ricercatori dell‚ÄôUniversit√† di Padova e dell‚ÄôIFOM hanno svelato nuovi meccanismi alla base dell‚Äôinvecchiamento.

üî∏L‚Äôinvecchiamento √® un fenomeno naturale che per√≤ si accompagna ad un progressivo declino di varie funzioni dell‚Äôorganismo. Ad esempio si assiste ad una diminuzione del rinnovo cellulare, accumulo di danni e mutazioni, riduzione dei processi cerebrali, ecc. I ricercatori hanno scoperto un altro meccanismo alla base del decadimento dei tessuti di supporto (connettivi) che sono responsabili di forma, sostegno meccanico e protezione di tanti organi.

üî∏Durante l‚Äôinvecchiamento, a livello molecolare, si assiste ad una progressiva diminuzione delle propriet√† meccaniche di particolari cellule, i FIBROBLASTI. Essi, quando sono giovani, riescono ad attivare un interruttore genico anti-invecchiamento, appunto, chiamato YAP/TAZ responsabile, ad esempio, del mantenimento dell‚Äôintegrit√† nucleare. Con l‚Äôinvecchiamento, per√≤, i fibroblasti non funzionano come dovrebbero e causano una perdita di integrit√† la quale, a suo volta, genera una condizione di stress per le cellule. Questa condizione scatena una reazione di allarme sistemica (stato infiammatorio cronico e sistemico) tipica della senescenza cellulare.

üêµVAIOLO DELLE SCIMMIE (monkeypox)üêµ
Il 23 luglio 2022 l'OMS ha dichiarato il vaiolo delle scimmie "'Emergenza di salute pubblica internazionale" 
Vediamo alcune informazioni:

üî∏TRASMISSIONE:
Il virus non si trasmette facilmente da persona a persona. La trasmissione umana avviene principalmente tramite il contatto con materiale infetto proveniente dalle lesioni cutanee o con oggetti contaminati (lenzuola, vestiti‚Ä¶), oppure il contatto prolungato faccia a faccia (attraverso droplets respiratori) e durante i rapporti intimi.

üî∏SINTOMI:
Nell‚Äôuomo si presenta con febbre, dolori muscolari, cefalea, rigonfiamento dei linfonodi  stanchezza e, successivamente, con manifestazioni cutanee quali vescicole, pustole, piccole croste. La malattia generalmente si risolve spontaneamente in 2-4 settimane con adeguato riposo e senza terapie specifiche, ma si possono usare antivirali se necessario. Tuttavia, il vaiolo delle scimmie pu√≤ causare una malattia pi√π grave soprattutto in alcuni gruppi di popolazione particolarmente fragili quali  bambini, donne in gravidanza e persone immunosoppresse. Il periodo di incubazione pu√≤ variare da 5 a 21 giorni (in genere circa 12 giorni).
Le complicanze del vaiolo delle scimmie possono includere infezioni batteriche secondarie, broncopolmonite, sepsi, encefalite e infezione della cornea con conseguente perdita della vista.

üî∏TRATTAMENTO:
√à possibile che le persone che sono state vaccinate contro il vaiolo (vaccinazione abolita in Italia nel 1981) siano a minor rischio di infezione con il monkeypox per la similitudine del virus del vaiolo con il monkeypox. Nell‚Äôattuale contesto epidemiologico non √® raccomandata la vaccinazione per la popolazione generale, anche se √® partita in 4 regioni italiane: Lombardia, Lazio, Emilia-Romagna e Veneto. 
Il trattamento del vaiolo delle scimmie √® sintomatico e di supporto, compresa la prevenzione e il trattamento delle infezioni batteriche secondarie. Un antivirale noto come Tecovirimat che √® stato sviluppato per il vaiolo, √® stato autorizzato dall‚ÄôEMA per il trattamento del vaiolo delle scimmie nel 2022 ma non √® ancora ampiamente disponibile.

Le malattie mitocondriali sono gravi malattie genetiche che ad oggi non hanno una cura e si manifestano interessando diversi organi ed il loro insorgere √® estremamente variabile sia per come si manifestano clinicamente sia per l'et√† dei pazienti colpiti. Tuttavia originano da un'inadeguata produzione di energia da parte delle cellula la quale, sostanzialmente, manifesta una disfunzione nella catena respiratoria. I sistemi che maggiormente sono colpiti sono il Sistema nervoso centrale e periferico e il sistema muscolare. 

Un team di ricercatori dell'Universit√† di Padova ha pubblicato su "Brain" uno studio in cui viene evidenziato come l'utilizzo di vettori virali adeno-associati in modelli murini √® utilizzato per contrastare le mutazioni cellulari alla base di alcune patologie.

‚û°Ô∏è In particolare, la catena respiratorie delle cellule √® formata da proteine di grandi dimensioni (cio√® complessi proteici). Uno di questi complessi proteici include, tra le 45 proteine che lo compongono, la proteina codificata dal gene NDUFS4, le cui mutazioni sono responsabili della sindrome di Leigh. 

Ci√≤ che √® stato osservato √® che introducendo nelle cellule di un modello murino il gene NDUFS4 umano non mutato attraverso dei virus modificati (cos√¨ da impedirne la replicazione) si ottengo risultati incoraggianti nel migliorare il decorso della malattia.
Quindi questo gruppo di ricercatori ha sviluppato un virus AAV in grado di ri-esprimere il gene umano NDUFS4 e lo hanno introdotto nei topi mutati alla nascita: 4 topi su 5 sono sopravvissuti oltre i 6 mesi rispetto alle 6 settimane di vita dei topi non trattati. Inoltre, i topi trattati hanno manifestato un minor deficit neurologico e motorio, ma anche minori deficit biochimici.

Uno studio pre-clinico pubblicato sulla rivista "Gut" dimostra che la PI3K-C2Œ≥ abbia un ruolo chiave nello sviluppo di uno dei tumori pi√π aggressivi: tumore del pancreas.

üìà  In Italia, ogni anno vengono diagnosticati circa 13.000 nuovi casi di tumore al pancreas e la percentuale di sopravvivenza a 5 anni √® inferiore al 10%. Si prevede che entro il 2030 questo tumore diventi la secondo causa di morte oncologica.

üò¥SVILUPPO DELLE METASTASI DURANTE IL SONNO

üìùSecondo uno studio pubblicato su Nature,¬†il processo che porta le cellule tumorali a staccarsi dal tumore primario per raggiungere altre parti del corpo attraverso il flusso sanguigno avviene pi√π nel sonno che nella veglia.

üìùOpinione molto diffusa era quella secondo la quale le cellule tumorali circolanti (CTC) si formassero costantemente o nascessero come reazione a stimoli meccanici (interventi chirurgici), ma questo in realt√† non √® sempre vero.¬†Il gruppo di ricerca ha prelevato un campione di sangue da 30 pazienti con cancro al seno due volte: alle 4 del mattino (fase di sonno) e alle 10 del mattino (fase di veglia). Ha cos√¨ scoperto che quasi l'80 per cento delle CTC totali proveniva dal campione di sangue notturno.

üìùQuale potrebbe essere la spiegazione?¬†Durante la fase di sonno, i geni responsabili della proliferazione cellulare risultavano sovra-regolati (cio√® sono pi√π attivi del solito). Lo studio dimostra in modo impressionante come la biologia delle cellule tumorali vari nell'arco delle 24 ore. Questa dipendenza circadiana potrebbe cambiare radicalmente il modo in cui i medici diagnosticano e trattano il cancro

Fenomeno della dormienza üò¥

La dormienza √®  un fenomeno molto importante, soprattutto per quanto riguarda la sua rilevanza clinica. Quello che sappiamo √® che ci sono una serie di tumori (ad esempio il tumore della mammella o della prostata) in cui ci sono periodi di rimessione lunghissimi, ma poi c'√® una recidiva anche dopo 10/20 anni. Quello che inizialmente si pensava √® che clinicamente si fosse sviluppato un nuovo tumore, in realt√† non √® cos√¨. Infatti, si √® evidenziato in seguito a biopsia ed analisi istologiche che questa ricaduta non dipendeva dalla formazione di una nuova massa tumorale, bens√¨ da metastasi che si sono sviluppate (nel precedente tumore) e che sono rimaste dormienti. Quello che accade in questo tipo di tumori, come quella alla mammella e alla prostata, √® che ci sono cellule che disseminano precocemente e vengono accolte da nicchie che hanno tutte le componenti per supportare lo stato di dormienza e  la proliferazione cellulare. 
Per cui queste cellule metastatiche, rimangono dormienti fino a quando segnali stressori non vanno ad attivarle.
Questo ha permesso di definire il concetto di malattia minima residua e il concetto di dipendenza da oncogeni.

üíäASPIRINA E PREVENZIONE ONCOLOGICA

Brevettato nel 1899 con il nome commerciale aspirina, questo medicinale fa parte dei cosiddetti farmaci antinfiammatori non steroidei (FANS) e viene utilizzato soprattutto per trattare sintomi come febbre, mal di testa, mal di denti, dolori mestruali, reumatici e muscolari.

Tra i vari tumori,  quello colorettale √® la neoplasia per la quale, al momento, l‚Äôaspirina sembra pi√π efficace in termini di prevenzione, tanto che nel 2016 la U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) statunitense ha pubblicato un documento nel quale suggeriva ufficialmente il suo utilizzo PER ALCUNE CATEGORIE DI PERSONE (Nota bene), per ridurre il rischio di malattie cardiovascolari e tumore colorettale.
Secondo il documento, per√≤, la terapia preventiva ha dei limiti e l‚Äôassunzione di aspirina a basse dosi √® consigliata in particolare agli adulti di et√† compresa tra 50 e 59 anni. Il farmaco infatti ha un‚Äôazione antiaggregante, ovvero impedisce alle piastrine di formare coaguli e rende pi√π fluido il sangue. Per questo, quando lo si usa quotidianamente, bisogna fare attenzione a eventuali sanguinamenti anche non visibili, per esempio quelli rilevabili con esame delle feci.
I risultati di prevenzione sono invece meno convincenti quando si tratta di persone tra i 60 e i 69 anni e non sono sufficienti a raccomandare l‚Äôuso del medicinale a chi ha meno di 50 o pi√π di 70 anni.
Sebbene i risultati nella prevenzione del tumore del colon-retto e in altre neoplasie sembrano promettenti, si potrebbe pensare di assumere un po‚Äô di aspirina ogni giorno per tenere alla larga il cancro. In realt√†, al momento sarebbe una scelta azzardata, se non per le categorie citate sopra per le quali la terapia √® gi√† raccomandata.

üçÖ POMODORO BIOFORTIFICATO E VITAMINA D üçÖ

üîªL‚Äôassunzione di vitamina D avviene prevalentemente da fonti animali (olio di fegato di merluzzo, salmone, aringa, spigola, uova), mentre tra gli alimenti vegetali troviamo in particolare alcuni funghi. Ciononostante, la principale via di sintesi ha luogo grazie all‚Äôesposizione ai raggi UV, in grado di attivare il 7-deidrocolesterolo (pelle) a pre-D3, la quale poi subir√† due idrossilazioni.

Da uno studio condotto dall‚ÄôIstituto di scienze delle produzioni alimentari del Cnr, in collaborazione con il John Innes Centre di Norwich e pubblicato sulla rivista¬†Nature Plants, viene progettata una nuova linea di pomodoro in grado di contrastare la carenza di vitamina D.

üîªIn cosa consiste?
Viene sfruttata una tecnica di editing del genoma, in particolare la CRISPR/Cas9, la quale ha consentito di introdurre, in modo molto specifico, una modifica nella sequenza del gene che codifica per la 7-deidrocolesterolo reduttasi 2. In questo modo, i frutti presentavano livelli notevoli di pro-vitaminaD3 e, se venivano trattati con luce UV, tale pro-vitaminaD3 veniva convertita in vitamina D.

Fonte:

Li, J., Scarano, A., Gonzalez, NM¬†et al.¬†I pomodori biofortificati forniscono una nuova strada verso la sufficienza di vitamina D.¬†Nat.¬†Piante¬†(2022).¬†https://doi.org/10.1038/s41477-022-01154-6

üíÆORCHIS ITALICA, L‚ÄôUOMO NUDO

üíÆL‚ÄôOrchis italica, comunemente nota come uomo nudo, √® un‚Äôorchidea (famiglia Orchidacee) molto diffusa nel Nord Africa, nella penisola iberica, nel Medio Oriente e nel centro-sud italiano. Nei mesi di marzo-maggio c‚Äô√® la sua fioritura.

üíÆLa caratteristica peculiare, da cui il nome ‚Äúuomo nudo‚Äù, deriva dalla curiosa forma del labello. Il labello √® un petalo delle orchidee modificato con lo scopo di attirare gli insetti impollinatori. Nella Orchis italica, tale labello assume una vera e propria forma ad uomo nudo, generalmente roseo con possibili variazioni dal bianco al porpora.

Da qualche giorno c'√® la notizia del primo virus in grado di poter uccidere cellule del cancro.
Al momento ci troviamo davanti ad una fase di sperimentazione per valutare la sicurezza e l'efficacia della somministrazione di questo virus sugli esseri umani.

Un nuovo¬†studio¬†ha individuato un¬†virus sperimentale¬†che uccide il cancro ed √® stato somministrato per la prima volta a un paziente umano, con la speranza di riuscire ad avere un nuovo mezzo per combattere con successo i tumori.

Il virus in questione √®, chiamato¬†CF33-hNIS (aka Vaxinia). Parliamo di un virus oncolitico, cio√® un virus geneticamente modificato progettato per infettare e uccidere selettivamente le cellule tumorali risparmiando quelle sane.

CF33-hNIS nello specifico √® un¬†virus del vaiolo¬†modificato¬†che agisce entrando nelle cellule e duplicandosi. Alla fine la cellula esplode, rilasciando particelle virali che agiscono come antigeni. Questo permette la stimolazione quindi del sistema immunitario che va ad attaccare le cellule tumorali vicine.

Per proseguire con i test devono essere arruolati circa 100 pazienti con tumore in fase avanzata o in fase metastatica.Una¬†volta arruolati, questi pazienti riceveranno basse dosi del trattamento sperimentale tramite iniezione diretta o per via endovenosa.

Se i primi risultati hanno successo e CF33-hNIS √® ritenuto sicuro e ben tollerato, ulteriori test indagheranno come il farmaco si accoppia con pembrolizumab, un trattamento anticorpale esistente gi√† utilizzato nell‚Äôimmunoterapia contro il cancro.

#biologia #biologybites

Il cortisolo √® un ormone prodotto dalle nostre ghiandole surrenali in risposta a forti stress fisici e mentali, proprio pet questo il cortisolo √® anche conosciuto come "ormone dello stress". La sua produzione risulta necessaria per incrementare la nostra energia. 

Con la sua azione, questo ormone tende ad inibire le funzioni corporee non indispensabili nel breve periodo, garantendo il massimo sostegno agli organi vitali. 

Per questo motivo il cortisolo:

‚óè aumenta la gittata cardiaca

‚óè aumenta la glicemia, incrementando la gluconeogenesi epatica andando a stimolare la secrezione di glucagone e riducendo l'attivit√† dei recettori insulinici 

‚óè diminuisce la sintesi di collagene e della matrice ossea, accelerando l'osteoporosi

‚óè abbassa le difese immunitarie diminuendo anche le reazioni infiammatorie 

‚óè favorisce il catabolismo proteico

√à importante dire che un aumento di cortisolo si manifesta anche in casi di digiuno prolungato o di abitudini alimentari non corrette. Infatti saltare la prima colazione e/o mangiare abbondantemente in un unico pasto favorisce un aumento della produzione di cortisolo. 

Per cui √® importante mantenere questo ormone sotto controllo in quanto condizioni di ipercortisolismo possono portare a spiacevoli conseguenze, come ad esempio:

‚óè Ipertensione

‚óè alterazioni del ciclo mestruale 

‚óè debolezza muscolare

‚óè cefalea 

‚óè depressione

‚óè osteoporosi

‚óè infezioni ricorrenti 

#biologybites #cortisolo

‚èπÔ∏èUBIQUITINAZIONE

Per Ubiquitinazione si intende una modificazione post-traduzionale che, spesso, viene effettuata per portare alla degradazione di una proteina. √à un processo fisiologico che prevede il legame di uno o pi√π monomeri di ubiquitina (raffigurata nella prima diapositiva) alla proteina da degradare.

L‚Äôubiquitina viene legata alla proteina bersaglio in modo covalente grazie all‚Äôazione di alcuni enzimi specifici (E1, E2, E3). Vediamo i vari passaggi:

1) Attivazione dell‚Äôubiquitina grazie all‚ÄôATP, che si lega come AMP;

2) Successivamente si ha la formazione di un legame tioestere ad alta energia tra un carbonile di una glicina e un residuo di cisteina dell‚Äôenzima E1;

3) In seguito, l‚Äôubiquitina viene trasferita su un‚Äôaltra cisteina presente nel sito attivo dell‚Äôenzima E2;

4) L‚Äôultimo passaggio prevede l‚Äôintervento dell‚Äôenzima E3 che, insieme ad E2, integra il substrato da degradare (target).

Il risultato √® il legame tra ubiquitina e target da degradare.

üü¶GLUCOSIO VS FRUTTOSIO

üîπSappiamo che il fruttosio, zucchero semplice, ha all‚Äôincirca le stesse calorie del glucosio ma un potere dolcificante superiore (quindi pu√≤ essere usato in quantit√† ridotte). Inoltre, il fruttosio presenta un indice glicemico inferiore e produce una risposta insulinica minore. Tutti parametri molto vantaggiosi che portano ad usarlo al posto del glucosio!!

üîπCiononostante, tale zucchero presenta un limite: i suoi effetti nell‚Äôorganismo sono profondamente diversi da quelli del glucosio. 

üîπIn questo post riportiamo i risultati di uno studio scientifico che, come principale obiettivo, prevedeva l‚Äôanalisi di fattori neurofisiologici basilari nelle associazioni tra consumo di fruttosio e aumento di peso. Gli autori hanno confrontato le variazioni fisiologiche a seguito dell‚Äôingestione di fruttosio con quelle ottenute dall‚Äôingestione di glucosio.

Il post di oggi non potevamo non dedicarlo ad una figura pilastro della societ√†, la MAMMA! Per tale motivo, abbiamo deciso di riportare pochi ma importanti concetti sull‚Äôimportanza dell‚Äôallattamento al seno.

‚óæL‚ÄôOrganizzazione Mondiale della Sanit√† considera l‚Äôallattamento uno degli obiettivi di salute pubblica a livello mondiale, tanto da raccomandarlo fino al sesto mese di et√†.
L‚ÄôUnicef, dal canto suo, ricorda che la diffusione dell‚Äôallattamento potrebbe evitare ogni anno nel mondo la morte di 1,4 milioni di bambini.

BEST GIFTS FOR NEW TEACHERS üéÅüçé

Whether you‚Äôre buying gifts for a friend or family member going into teaching or you are going into your first year of teaching yourself, I‚Äôve got you covered! üéâ

üñ§‚ÜóÔ∏èüè≥Ô∏è Like, share, and save!

1Ô∏è‚É£ LAMINATOR üìÉ
Most schools have laminators for teachers to use, but the lamination is thin, peels easily, and the machines have a tendency to break often. A personal laminator provides thicker lamination that can be cut without peeling (and it‚Äôs a great way to make friends with other teachers in the building)!
‚ú®TIP:‚ú® Having 2 laminators (one for school & one for home) is a GAME CHANGER!

2Ô∏è‚É£ PAPER CUTTER ‚úÇÔ∏è
Similar to laminators, most schools have paper cutters available but they tend to have extremely dull blades that bend the paper instead of cutting it. A personal paper cutter saves your hands (scissor blisters, anyone?!) and is much faster!
‚ú®TIP:‚ú® There are half-size paper cutters that can easily be stored in a drawer!

3Ô∏è‚É£ BOOKSüìö
Teachers can never have enough books! Between professional development books and read aloud books, they have the perfect gift! Check out my list of favorites here: ‚¨áÔ∏è

Life lately üñ§
I‚Äôve been pretty MIA here on Instagram so it‚Äôs time to fill you in. There have been a lot of ups & plenty of downs. Some I‚Äôll share & some I won‚Äôt. We all know that social media never tells the full story & there‚Äôs always more happening behind the scenes that doesn‚Äôt get shown but here are a few updates:

üö® MOST RELEVANT - Change is coming (which is scary but also exciting) üò¨ I‚Äôll do a more formal post soon with the details, but for now‚Ä¶ just know that this is a crazy time for me & I‚Äôm going to do my best to share the journey with you.

 ü•∞ PERSONAL - I've been trying to figure out what makes me happiest, how I can best serve others, the impact I can make, ways I can set and reach goals that are important to me, & how I can provide value to the world. I‚Äôve had moments of, ‚ÄúWhat am I even doing with my life?‚Äù (AKA a mid-life crisis at the age of 30) but also, ‚ÄúMichelle, you can do hard things & make a difference‚Äù so I‚Äôm trying to balance being courageous, realistic, & genuine without sacrificing too much of what makes me, me üñ§

üåç TRAVEL - Germany was beautiful üá©üá™ I love seeing how uniquely different cultures are, yet we are all so similar at our core as human beings. üìö BOOKS - I‚Äôve read 27 books so far this year, so I‚Äôm over halfway to my goal of reading 52 books in a year üéâ 

ü•ó FOOD - Y‚Äôall know I love food üòçüòã Lately, I‚Äôve loved trying new recipes & experimenting with flavors. It‚Äôs been a mix of foods that are good for my body & good for my soul, & they both make me happy.

üí™üèº FITNESS - Oh yeah, I still lift heavy things & put them down üòÇ I competed in a powerlifting meet at the end of April‚Ä¶ I qualified for Nationals again in a new weight class (52kg), got 1st place for females, & got drug tested for the first time (which is exciting because it feels like an accomplishment that I‚Äôm strong enough to get tested üòÖ). Intentional.

That's my word for 2024.

Intentional with my goals üéØ
Intentional with my actions ‚úÖ
Intentional with my heath üçé
Intentional with my relationships üñ§
Intentional with my training üí™üèº
Intentional with my planning ‚úèÔ∏è

Intention, by definition, means having an aim. A plan.

I've always been a planner (I'm sure that's no surprise) but I'm also a huge creature of habit (aka I fall into a routine and it's hard for me to break out of it).

If I'm not careful, weeks will go by where I'm stuck in a routine like a hamster on a wheel without making any real progress. Can anyone else relate or is this a me problem?! üòÖüêπ

One of the first changes I made this year was to set aside time each day to INTENTIONALLY plan my days, weeks, and months ahead... aka make sure that wheel is actually moving forward instead of just rotating in place üõûüòÇ

My digital planner has been the perfect accountability buddy and has helped me be as productive as possible in the few minutes I dedicate to my personal planning each day ü•∞

Who else has a "word" for the year? If so, what is it and what have you done so far to embrace that word? Tell me down in the comments üëáüèº

Organize your small group rotations AUTOMATICALLY using Canva! üíª‚è≤Ô∏èüéâ

You can adjust the settings to make the slides transition when the timer ends so you never have to touch your slides and they will automatically run once you start presenting!

HOW TO:
1. Create a slideshow presentation in Canva
2. Add a title and table to outline your small group rotations
3. Add a timer video to the slide
4. Click the video, click ‚ÄúPlayback‚Äù, and make sure ‚ÄúPlay automatically‚Äù is toggled on
5. Create a transition slide (such as a ‚ÄúClean up‚Äù slide with directions) if desired
6. Duplicate the rotations slide and transition slide as many times as needed to match the number of rotations (3 rotations = 3 copies of each)
7. Click ‚ÄúPresent‚Äù, click ‚ÄúAutoplay‚Äù, and then click ‚ÄúPresent‚Äù at the bottom
